creator: scienceguy4
title: Combining MakeyMakey, CircuitScribe and Scratch to Create Art
description: This project combines MakeyMakey, CircuitScribe, and Scratch to create an interactive art installation. By drawing conductive lines with a CircuitScribe pen and connecting them to a MakeyMakey, you can trigger actions in a Scratch program, such as controlling a dancer's movements by tapping on the paper.
steps: Draw tap pads on a piece of paper using a CircuitScribe pen.  Ensure the lines are conductive by going over them multiple times to avoid breaks in the ink.
Label each tap pad with the desired dance move (e.g., "Restart", "Split", "Tilt Jump").
Connect alligator clips to one end of each conductive line.
Connect the other end of each alligator clip cable to the MakeyMakey board, mapping each tap pad to a specific letter or number.
In Scratch, choose a background and costumes (dancer sprites) for the project.
Create scripts for the dancer sprite and any button sprites to respond to keyboard input or button clicks.
Write scripts that change the dancer's costume based on the input received from the MakeyMakey (corresponding to taps on the conductive lines).
Combine the hardware and software components to make an interactive art installation.
